viewsWelcome.contents:
Welcome to the GitLab Workflow extension! 
 [Authenticate to GitLab instance](command:gl.authenticate)
To learn more, read [the setup information](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-vscode-extension#setup) for this extension.

No Git repository available. To learn how to fix this, check the Source Control tab.
[Open Source Control](command:workbench.view.scm)

Multiple GitLab accounts found for this workspace.
[Select an account](command:gl.selectWorkspaceAccount)

You can push the current folder to a new GitLab project.
[$(gitlab-logo) Publish to GitLab](command:gl.publishToGitLab)

You can push any of the current folders to a new GitLab project.
[$(gitlab-logo) Publish to GitLab](command:gl.publishToGitLab)

gitlab.duoCodeSuggestions.openTabsContex.description: Use the contents of open tabs as context

gitlab.certKey.description: Custom certificate key file to use (example: /etc/ssl/certs/certificateKey.key)

gitlab.ignoreCertificateErrors.description: Ignore TLS/SSL certificate errors when calling the GitLab API

gitlab.branchProtection.description: Apply branch protection rules from GitLab

gitlab.showStatusBarLinks.description: Display all GitLab-related links in the status bar (requires restarting Visual Studio Code)
gitlab.showStatusBarLinks.deprecationMessage: To hide an item from the status bar, right-click the item in VS Code.

gitlab.showIssueLinkOnStatusBar.description: Display the GitLab issue link in the status bar
gitlab.showIssueLinkOnStatusBar.deprecationMessage: To hide an item from the status bar, right-click the item in VS Code.

gitlab.showMrStatusOnStatusBar.description: Display the GitLab merge request status in the status bar
gitlab.showMrStatusOnStatusBar.deprecationMessage: To hide an item from the status bar, you should right-click the item in VS Code.

gitlab.pipelineGitRemoteName.description: Name of the Git remote to use when locating the GitLab project for your pipeline. Keep empty for default

gitlab.showPipelineUpdateNotifications.description: Show notification in VS Code when the pipeline status changes

name.description: The label to show in the GitLab panel

maxResults.description: The maximum number of results to show

orderBy.description: Return issues ordered by the selected value. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

sort.description: Return issues sorted in ascending or descending order. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

scope.description: Return GitLab items for the given scope. Not applicable for epics. "assigned_to_me" and "created_by_me" are not applicable for vulnerabilities. "dismissed" is not applicable for issues and merge requests

type.description: The type of GitLab items to return. If 'snippets' is selected, no other filters work. Epics available only on GitLab Ultimate or GitLab Gold.

noItemText.description: The text to show if the query returns no items

state.description: Return "all" issues or just those that are "opened" or "closed". Not applicable for vulnerabilities

labels.description: Array of label names. The GitLab item must have all labels to be returned. "None" lists all GitLab items with no labels. "Any" lists all GitLab issues with at least one label. Predefined names are not case-sensitive. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

milestone.description: The milestone title. "None" lists all GitLab items with no milestone. "Any" lists all GitLab items that have an assigned milestone. Not applicable for epics and vulnerabilities

author.description: Return GitLab items created by the given username. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

assignee.description: Returns GitLab items assigned to the given username. "None" returns unassigned GitLab items. "Any" returns GitLab items with an assignee. Not applicable for epics and vulnerabilities

search.description: Search GitLab items against their title and description. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

searchIn.description: Modify the scope of the search attribute. Not applicable for epics and vulnerabilities

createdAfter.description: Return GitLab items created after the given date. ISO 8601 formatted, like 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

createdBefore.description: Return GitLab items created before the given date. ISO 8601 formatted, like 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

updatedAfter.description: Return GitLab items updated after the given date. ISO 8601 formatted, like 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

updatedBefore.description: Return GitLab items updated before the given date. ISO 8601 formatted, like 2016-03-11T03:45:40Z. Not applicable for vulnerabilities

wip.description: Filter merge requests against their draft status. "yes" to return only draft merge requests, "no" to return non-draft merge requests. Works only with merge requests. This parameter is an alias for "draft"

draft.description: Filter merge requests against their draft status. "yes" to return only draft merge requests, "no" to return non-draft merge requests. Works only with merge requests

confidential.description: Filter confidential or public issues. Works only with issues

excludeLabels.description: Array of label names the GitLab item must not have to be returned. Predefined names are not case-sensitive. Works only with issues

excludeMilestone.description: The milestone title to exclude. Works only with issues

excludeAuthor.description: Return GitLab items not created by the given username. Works only with issues

excludeAssignee.description: Returns GitLab items not assigned to the given username. Works only with issues

excludeSearch.description: Search GitLab items without the search key in their title or description. Works only with issues

excludeSearchIn.description: Modify the scope of the excludeSearch attribute. Works only with issues

reportTypes.description: Returns vulnerabilities belonging to specified report types. Works only with vulnerabilities

severityLevels.description: Returns vulnerabilities belonging to specified severity levels. Defaults to 'all'. Works only with vulnerabilities

confidenceLevels.description: Returns vulnerabilities belonging to specified confidence levels. Defaults to 'all'. Works only with vulnerabilities

reviewer.description: Returns GitLab merge requests assigned for review to the given username. When set to "<current_user>", the current user's username is used.

default.name: Merge requests assigned to me
default.noItemText: No merge requests assigned to you.

default.name: Merge requests I'm reviewing
default.noItemText: No merge requests for you to review.

default.name: Merge requests created by me
default.noItemText: No merge requests created by you.

default.name: All project merge requests
default.noItemText: The project has no merge requests

gitlab.customQueries.description: Custom views in the GitLab panel

walkthroughs.title: How to use GitLab Workflow
walkthroughs.description: **Your workflow, your way.** View issues, create merge requests, and access GitLab Duo AI features from your IDE.

steps.title: Authenticate with GitLab
steps.description:
For GitLab.com and GitLab Dedicated, [sign in](command:gl.authenticate) with your GitLab account.

For GitLab Self-Managed, [generate a personal access token, then sign in](command:gl.authenticate) with it.

Having installation issues? Review the [setup instructions](https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-vscode-extension#setup). If you can't access paid features, contact your administrator.

steps.title: Accept a GitLab Duo Code Suggestion
steps.description: To receive Code Suggestions generated by AI, open a [supported file type](https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/user/project/repository/code_suggestions/supported_extensions.html#supported-languages) and start writing code. Press ``Tab`` to accept a suggestion, ``Escape`` to cancel, or continue typing to ignore.

steps.title: Generate a Code Suggestion
steps.description:
While writing a comment, give an instruction in natural language, then press ``Enter``.

GitLab Duo generates a Code Suggestion based on the context of your comment and the rest of your code.

steps.title: Ask Duo Chat a question about code
steps.description:
Highlight some code, and ask Duo Chat a question to get contextual answers.
Write tests, refactor, or explain highlighted code. Right-click or enter ``/`` in Duo Chat to use slash commands.
[Open Duo Chat](command:gl.openChat)

steps.title: Learn with the Duo Tutorial
steps.description:
Boost your productivity with interactive exercises that teach advanced Duo techniques.
 Run the [GitLab: Duo Tutorial](command:gl.duoTutorial) command to start.

steps.title: Review your assigned issues
steps.description: GitLab Workflow is separate from Duo Chat in the activity bar. Open it and expand [**Issues and Merge Requests**](command:issuesAndMrs.focus) to view your assigned issues, and leave comments without leaving VS Code.

steps.title: Create a merge request
steps.description: When you're on a feature branch, use [**Create MR**](command:gl.openCreateNewMR), in the status bar at the bottom of VS Code to start a merge request in the GitLab UI.
